alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 5:10PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Choctaw, northwestern Washington and Wayne Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 510 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Waynesboro, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Chatom, Clara, Millry and Buckatunna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
